CatDescriptText: Norma B. Patrick, social case worker, 233 Mayflower Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 21, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you favor an increase in state sales tax or a graduated income tax as a means of raising revenue for a commonwealth of Pennsylvania?" answer reads: "A graduated income tax is teh lesser of two evils. I don't think that t 4 per cent sales tax will bring in enough income.  I would rather have the income tax, rather than to see the budget of the public assistance program cut.  Needy persons now are not getting enough."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Norma B. Patrick wearing light colored coat with four buttons, dark hat and gloves, standing in front of Bud Saunders Flowers in Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
